page.title: 09RUSHDEN HALL:RUSHDEN
page.content: Rushden Hall is one of several interest -ing buildings in the area.Nowadays it is used as council offices but it was once a home.There has possibly been a house on the site since before the Conquerer's time.Certainly in 1298 a house was owned there by Edmund,Duke of Lancaster,possibly a hunting lodge.The Pemberton family owned the hall from 1460 to 1639.The main part of the house was constructed in local limestone dur- ing the 17th century. The dining room is special because of its oak panelling which has various designs of people eating.The drawing room has got a stain ed glass window.From the windows at the front you can look out over the park to the bandstand where various bands still play on summer Sundays.The Hall gardens are delightful,there are many types of trees and flowers.The old kitchen garden is now a Garden Centre.
